section.title: Font Conventions
section.para: This book follows certain conventions for font usage. Understanding these conventions up-front makes it easier to use this book.

section.title: Command-line conventions
section.para: From time to time, this book discusses command-line instructions. When we do, output produced by the console (e.g. command promts or screen output) is displayed in normal characters, and commands (what you type) are written in bold. For example: $ ls -al total 168 drwxr-xr-x 16 johnsmart staff 544 21 Jan 07:20 . drwxr-xr-x+ 85 johnsmart staff 2890 21 Jan 07:10 .. -rw-r--r-- 1 tombarber staff 30 26 May 2009 .owner -rw-r--r--@ 1 tombarber staff 1813 16 Apr 2009 config.xml drwxr-xr-x 181 tombarber staff 6154 26 May 2009 fingerprints drwxr-xr-x 17 tombarber staff 578 16 Apr 2009 jobs drwxr-xr-x 3 tombarber staff 102 15 Apr 2009 log drwxr-xr-x 63 tombarber staff 2142 26 May 2009 plugins -rw-r--r-- 1 tombarber staff 46 26 May 2009 queue.xml -rw-r--r--@ 1 tombarber staff 64 13 Nov 2008 secret.key -rw-r--r-- 1 tombarber staff 51568 26 May 2009 update-center.json drwxr-xr-x 3 tombarber staff 102 26 May 2009 updates drwxr-xr-x 3 tombarber staff 102 15 Apr 2009 userContent drwxr-xr-x 12 tombarber staff 408 17 Feb 2009 users drwxr-xr-x 28 tombarber staff 952 26 May 2009 war

Where necessary, the backslash character at the end of the line is used to indicate a line-break: you can type this all on one line (without the backslash) if you prefer. Don't forget to ignore the '>' character at the start of the subsequent lines - it's a unix prompt character:$ wget -O - http://hudson-ci.org/debian/hudson-ci.org.key \ > | sudo apt-key add -For consistancy, unless we are discussing a Windows-specific issue, we will use Unix-style command prompts (the dollar sign, '$'), as shown here:
However, unless we say otherwise, Windows users can safely use these commands from the Windows command console:C:\Documents and Settings\Owner> java -jar hudson.war
